name: ListCashDrawerShifts
description:
Retrieve cash drawer shift details for a location and date range.

This tool provides details for all the cash drawer shifts for a specified location within a given date range. It should be called when cash drawer shift information is needed, such as start and end times, cash amounts, or other shift details for financial tracking and auditing purposes.

parameters.name: location_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the location to query for cash drawer shifts.

value_schema.description: The ID of the location to query for a list of cash drawer shifts.

parameters.name: sort_order_for_listing
parameters.description: Specifies the order for listing cash drawer shifts by their opened_at field. Use 'ASC' for ascending or 'DESC' for descending. Defaults to 'ASC'.

value_schema.description:
The order in which cash drawer shifts are listed in the response,
based on their opened_at field. Default value: ASC

parameters.name: query_start_time
parameters.description: The inclusive start time for the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

value_schema.description: The inclusive start time of the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: exclusive_end_date
parameters.description: The exclusive end time of the query on opened_at, specified in ISO 8601 format, to define the endpoint for the cash drawer shift search.

value_schema.description: The exclusive end date of the query on opened_at, in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: result_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of cash drawer shift events per results page. Defaults to 200, with a maximum of 1000.

value_schema.description:
Number of cash drawer shift events in a page of results (200 by
default, 1000 max).

parameters.name: next_page_cursor
parameters.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results, used for pagination.

value_schema.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the squareup API.

default, 1000 max).

value_schema.description:

default, 1000 max).

parameters.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results.

value_schema.description: Opaque cursor for fetching the next page of results.
